name: Avoid Sections with High Cyclomatic Complexity (PHP)
description:
This rule searches for all sections with High Cyclomatic Complexity.
           Cyclomatic Complexity is a measure of the complexity of the control structure of an artifact. It is the number of linearly independent paths and also the minimum number of independent paths while executing the software. 
           The threshold is a parameter and can be changed as per requirement.
output:
This report lists all sections with a High Cyclomatic Complexity.

This QR provides the following information:
Section full name.
rationale:
Cyclomatic Complexity computes the number of linearly independent paths and a lower boundary of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations.
      
The effort and time for diagnosis of deficiencies or causes of failures, or for
identification of parts to be modified is directly related to the number of execution paths, i.e. the
complexity of the control flow.

Analyzability, changeability and testability decreases with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity.

Each modification must be correct for all execution paths. 
Complete testing requires coverage of all execution paths.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of PHP sections with a High Cyclomatic Complexity.
alternativeName: Avoid Sections with High Cyclomatic Complexity (PHP)

qualityStandards.name: Callable and Method Control Element Excessive Cyclomatic Complexity Value
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid overly complex control flow

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of structured programming degrades comprehensibility

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable control element or method control element has a control flow with a Cyclomatic Complexity number that exceeds a threshold value. Default threshold value for Cyclomatic Complexity is 20

qualityStandards.name: Excessive McCabe Cyclomatic Complexity
qualityStandards.description: The code contains McCabe cyclomatic complexity that exceeds a desirable maximum.
